payload.text: crea una landing page que sea mi portfolio profesional. Basate en los datos de mi LinkedIn. Incluí galería de imagenes con las agencias en las cuales trabajé

**Designing the Prototype**

I'm working on the initial design for a portfolio landing page, focusing on creating a highly customizable template. I'm populating it with realistic placeholder data since I don't have direct access to the user's LinkedIn profile. Right now I'm building out the image gallery section which will be showcasing agency work.


**Refining the Aesthetics**

I'm now prioritizing a clean, high-end aesthetic, keeping the target audience in mind. Responsive design is a must, starting mobile-first. I'm exploring a dark/light mode toggle for added user control. Interactive elements are also on the table. Considering using framer-motion or simple Tailwind transitions. I am organizing the page into sections: Hero, About, Experience, Skills, Projects, and Contact.
I am planning the integration of a Gemini API to add a "Chat with my Resume" feature.

entries.description: Main application component assembling all sections.

payload.text: por favor, que sea oscuro, y con la opción de Dark y Light Mode. Además reemplaza el globo del chat por el del Whatsapp. Y que no tenga secciones sino que sea landing page, y que cuando toquemos la parte de Experiencia, Portfolio, Habilidades, se redirija a esa sección adentro de la landing

**Considering Design Choices**

I'm currently focused on the design implications of switching to dark mode by default. I want to create a toggle that's intuitive. Beyond that, I need to think about how to best replace the AI Assistant with the WhatsApp Chat toggle, making sure the user experience remains seamless. I'm also ensuring the switch looks good.


**Refining Single Page Scrolling**

I'm now refining the single-page landing behavior, verifying smooth scrolling between sections using the navigation links. I'm ensuring correct section targeting with the `href="#id"` links. I'm also planning high-end aesthetic improvements for visual consistency.

payload.text:
Este es mi perfil de LinkedIn. Por favor, tomalo para la parte de experiencia: https://www.linkedin.com/in/maximiliano-gottig-504201129/
Que parte de experiencia tenga el logo de la agencia a la derecha, y la fecha y puesto a la izquierda, superpuesto. Es decir que en la proxima la imagen esté a la izquierda y el texto a la derecha

**Updating Portfolio Data**

I'm currently focused on extracting the necessary information from Maximiliano Gottig's LinkedIn profile to update the `PORTFOLIO_DATA` within `constants.ts`. The initial data point, the name, is confirmed as Maximiliano Gottig. I am now proceeding to accurately capture and incorporate the title information.


**Analyzing Experience Section**

I've moved on to meticulously deconstructing Maximiliano's work experience to create the zig-zag layout for the "Experience" section. I'm focusing on the dates, titles, and company logos, so I can ensure the presentation is alternating as desired. This also includes mapping the logic for how the logos and text blocks alternate side to side, and making sure the information is presented professionally. I'm also ensuring the WhatsApp icon remains from a previous step, as requested.

payload.text: El background tiene que ser animado, con esferas de color azul oscuro que se muevan. Y que el cursor no sea una flecha sino una burbuja

**Designing the Visuals**

I'm now focusing on the aesthetic overhaul. I'm visualizing the animated dark blue spheres. Thinking about how the bubble pointer will integrate, instead of that standard arrow. I plan to retain the existing portfolio structure, incorporating these visual changes seamlessly with the current structure (Maximiliano Gottig).


**Refining The Aesthetics**

I'm now implementing the dark mode design, focusing on subtle dark blue blurred spheres for depth, using CSS animations for efficiency, but may use canvas/SVG for more complex effects. I'm also adding a semi-transparent circle to follow the mouse, with a slight delay. I'm prioritizing high-end aesthetics and professionalism throughout.

payload.text: Necesito que el fondo sea animado, con esferas u ondas de color violeta que se muevan

**Considering Background Animation**

I'm currently focused on the background animation update. Right now, I'm thinking of replacing the existing dark blue spheres with violet elements, potentially waves. The user's request for "violeta" is central to this update. I'm aiming for something dynamic and visually appealing, moving away from the static spheres.


**Updating Background Animation**

I'm now implementing the color changes in `App.tsx`, swapping the blues and indigos for violet and fuchsia shades, specifically targeting `bg-violet-600/20`, `bg-fuchsia-600/20`, `bg-purple-600/10` and `bg-violet-900/30`. I'm also considering the "waves" aspect and will refine the sphere animation in `index.html` to improve the fluid effect, given the "esferas u ondas de color violeta" request.

entries.description: Update background animation to feature violet spheres and fluid wave-like movements.
Enhance keyframes for smoother fluid/wave-like movement and update scrollbar color to violet.

payload.text: Arma un fondo animado para todo el sitio

**Considering Animated Backgrounds**

I'm exploring animated backgrounds for the portfolio site. I've got some initial "blob" animations in `App.tsx` and `index.html`. The user also expressed interest in "Arm" animations, so I'm investigating how to integrate these different animation types seamlessly, ensuring they complement the content. I'm focusing on user experience, ensuring the animations enhance, not distract, from the portfolio's purpose.

entries.description: Enhance background animations with more fluid, non-linear movement and add a subtle grain texture for a premium look.
Implement a more complex layered animated background with violet gradients, grain texture, and orbiting elements.

payload.text: Quiero que la Hero Section tenga animaciones con burbujas y ondas de color azul

**Analyzing Animation Integration**

I'm currently focused on integrating the requested bubble and blue wave animations into the `Hero` section of the portfolio app. I've pinpointed `Hero.tsx` as the target component and have identified the existing background system in `App.tsx` as a point of reference and a potential area for coordination. I'm considering best practices to ensure a smooth transition while keeping things streamlined.


**Refining Animation Implementation**

I'm now zeroing in on the wave animation implementation. I've decided to create the wave animation through CSS and avoid SVGs for simplicity. I'll add a new `wave` animation keyframe in `index.html` to control the movement, and have identified that large, blurry divs will create the desired effect within the `Hero.tsx` component. The `Hero.tsx` component is where I'll add a specific container to hold the blue animated elements (bubbles/waves), while keeping the existing text content intact, using blues (cyan, sky, blue).

entries.description: Add a specialized 'wave' keyframe animation for the Hero section and extend the 'float' animation for bubbles.
Add blue animated bubbles and wave-like blobs to the Hero section background while maintaining the content structure.

**Expanding the Hero Section**

I'm currently focused on expanding the visual elements of the `Hero` section. My priority is to add *more* dynamic bubbles and waves within `Hero.tsx`. I've noted that we already have one primary blue wave and a cyan secondary wave, plus four small floating bubbles. The objective is to enhance the existing visual dynamism through additional, visually similar elements.

payload.text: En la parte de Experience, Portfolio y Skills pone de fondo ondas que se muevan por cada una de las secciones

**Considering Animated Backgrounds**

I'm currently focused on replicating the animated background elements from my `Hero` section to the `Experience`, `Portfolio`, and `Skills` sections. Right now, I have animated blue waves and bubbles in `Hero.tsx`, and I need to figure out how to integrate similar animations effectively in the other sections, specifically using `App.tsx` and the other sections' respective components.


**Adding Section-Specific Backgrounds**

I'm making progress adding unique, animated backgrounds to each section. I've decided to leverage consistent styling (Tailwind) but vary colors and positions. For Experience, I'm leaning toward indigo/violet waves to reflect innovation. Portfolio will likely get sky blue or light purple waves to maintain a clean aesthetic for the "selected collection." Deep violet for the skills section, to convey technical depth, is also on the cards.

**Expanding the Portfolio Design**

I'm now focused on expanding the animated bubble and wave effects beyond the Hero section. My goal is to integrate these dynamic elements seamlessly into the Experience, Portfolio, and Skills sections. I aim to create a cohesive and engaging user experience across the entire website.


**Confirming Coherent Animations**

I'm now implementing the bubble and wave animations consistently across the entire site. I'm focusing on `Experience`, `Portfolio`, and `Skills`, and ensuring that the animation styles defined in `index.html` are used, but at a more subtle level to avoid clutter, as the user wants. I am trying to maintain the same feeling of dynamism but scale it appropriately for each section.
